DPRK Players Come First at 6th World Junior Taekwon-Do 
    Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- DPRK players came first in total at the 6th World Junior Taekwon-Do Championships held in Malaysia from July 27 to 30.
 It brought together more than 300 players from 49 countries including Russia, Malaysia, Tajikistan, Japan and the U.S.    
 The players of the DPRK carried off 17 gold medals, 2 silver medals, 3 bronze medals and 6 cups.

Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Choe Hyong Gwan 
    Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il sent a wreath to the bier of Col. General of the KPA Choe Hyong
Gwan, deputy to the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on August 1, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.content:
Greetings to Macedonian President
    Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Macedonian President Branko Crvenkovski on the national day of the country.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to favorably develop, the message sincerely wished him great success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country and the welfare of the Macedonian people.

articles.title: Greetings to Foreign Minister of Macedonia
articles.content:
Greetings to Macedonian Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a message of greetings to Macedonian Prime Minister Hari Kostov on the occasion of its national day.
 The message wholeheartedly wished him great success in his responsible work to achieve solid stability and economic progress of the country.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Calls on Norodom Sihanouk
articles.content:
Greetings to Foreign Minister of Macedonia
    Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to Ilinka Mitreva, foreign minister of the Republic of Macedonia, on the national day of the country.
 Expressing support to the efforts of Macedonia which desires entry into the European Union, the message sincerely wished him greater success in his responsible work for enhancing the external position of the country.
